channel.title: Were to start
channel.description:
I've been reading the rs2 client hacking section for a while... and would really like to know were and how to start.
I would also like to know:
[ul][li] What Bcel is [/li] [li] Why is it needed [/li] [li] What are hooks? [/li][/ul]
I think thats it, but if I do think of anything else, I will post it on this topic.
Thanks, x19

item.title: Were to start
item.dc:creator: @animefreak animefreak
item.description:
@animefreak wrote:

Silver Lining:

Begin by learning that “Bcel” does not exist. It’s a fucking acronym, dipshit. Treat it like one, because “bcel” isn’t even phonetically possible. Then learn that questions end with a special punctuation mark. Following that, find that “thats” is not a word. Finally, realize signing posts is only practiced by “moparscapers”, which is a euphemism for “illiterate fucktard”.

Not phonetically possible IN ENGLISH!

Read full topic

[/quote]
As do I, despite it’s obvious phonetic incorrectness. Saying BEE SEE EEE ELL is largely impractical.[/quote]Really, if you’re actually saying BCEL out loud, you need to get something more interesting to talk about. Last time I talked about computer-related things in a verbal environment, I learned that people who actually talk about computers are batshit insane. Thanks, Rictoo.

[quote=“frank_, post:9, topic:182979”]thats pretty mean, silver lining, bcel is great.

~frank_[/quote]SORRY SIR. WILL NOT CRITICIZE bcel EVER AGAIN SIR.

item.title: Were to start

@super_OLDACCOUNT wrote:

hooks themselves are interfaces used to define what the obfuscated classes represent, allong with methods used to access their behaviour

Read full topic

item.title: Were to start
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

thats alright, but ill have a stab at explaining it in my own words despite being sleep deprived.

as previously stated, bcel is a library for modifying java bytecode. the purpose of a bytecode library is the give structure to the classfile data so that you may programatically modify a classfile. asm is another bytecode library that some other people prefer.

modifying the client by bytecode is needed because it is no longer efficient to attempt to decompile and match on the source of classes, though it may still work if you were to write a decent deobfuscator.

different people call hooks different things, i think of them as the methods that grab data from the client on runtime

Read full topic

item.title: Were to start

item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

We need to sticky a FAQ. It might educate the few n00bs that come this way as to proper etiquette and scope of these forums as well as provide useful information to those who are able to ask the right questions in non-internet speak as above.

Read full topic

item.title: Were to start
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

BCEL is the Byte Code Engineering Library. It allows you to modify compiled Java code (bytecode).
It is needed so that we can figure out which class is which, then modify the class so we can control it. Because Jagex obfuscates the client, the names of the classes change randomly, so we need to look for patterns in the bytecode, with BCEL.
Hooks are essentially code that finds a pattern in the bytecode. You could write a hook to find the ‘client’ class (which is easy, because the client class in named ‘client’ and it contains the ‘main’ method). You could also write a hook to find any other class, by finding a consistent pattern in the bytecode, then looking for it every time the client updates.

frank_: If I explained badly, please elaborate, without the use of the words ‘twat’ or ‘big boys’.

Read full topic
